page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: Historically,the area was dominated by the docks and the old associated industries.The area surrounding the docks is densely populated,and contains many homes that are in very poor condition. Unemployment is extremely high.To try to counteract this,the area was made a freeport. The Government has also directed jobs to the area eg.Girobank and Inland Revenue Offices. As you move away from the docks the housing standards increase,although the vast majority is municipal housing. There are a number of parks and open spaces.The north-east of the area is bounded by Bootle Golf Course and Walton Prison dominates the south-east boundry. The schools tend to be post-war buildings away from the dock area. The Roman Catholic church is the dominant religious influence.
